intro: Pentas arvensis, commonly known as field pentas, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces clusters of small, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red, blooming from summer to autumn. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The leaves are opposite, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture.
